intro: Cacalia lanceolaris, commonly known as the narrowleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Cacalia lanceolaris is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
